alert.note: Alert for Clay (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 10:11PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Corning affecting Clay County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Black River At Corning. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date Black River Corning 15.0 11.3 Fri 9 PM 11.9 12.8 13.0 13.0 7 AM 3/27 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
